"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. body: I do tend to think the pagan gods might be real demons. However I wouldn't jump to conclusions. There is plenty of paganism in the old testament, and it's because it was edited by evil scribes to support such atrocity. Things like animal sacrifice, burning people at the stake, racism against Moabites and gentiles, hatred of eunuchs, invading foreign areas for no reason and killing and torturing everyone even the children and animals, priestly hierarchy, prophets killing children for the pettiest reasons, likely circumcision, and all those crazy gut-wrenching passages are later additions by scribes. Probably the really silly and petty rules too like not eating pork. It's hard to date when it first began and I suspect a few changes here and there have been introduced from the beginning as usual. But it appears that when it really picked up was in the time of Josiah. It says he rediscovered the holy and sacred book of rules of God that had somehow been misplaced for years in the temple. Riiiiiiiiiiiiight. And these supposedly "rediscovered" lost books of God very conveniently situated Josiah in positions of power and shat on exactly people he didn't like. He was later killed in battle that God told him not to engage in. Meanwhile Jeremiah was receiving prophesy about this and recorded it in his book which he sent to Josiah's son Jehoiakim, who hated it so much that as soon as he was done reading a page he'd throw it in his fireplace to be burned. This wouldn't be the last major fraud and redaction either, as after the return from the exile in Babylon further redactions were made, garbling the order of the prophets, editing the text to conform with later beliefs, adding even more laws, etc. It is likely that Ezra-Nehemiah are behind this one, whom even orthodox jews admit probably changed the text (interestingly an apocryphal book of Ezra records a story similar to Josiah's, where the law has been supposedly burnt by invading troops so Ezra rewrites it himself, as if there's only one copy of such sacred scripture. Quite an elaborate excuse he spun up if this account is accurate). This is the real reason the new testament contradicts the old testament so much (as well as the old testament itself often times). Because much of it is falsified by scribes. It's also why so many good characters in the old testament had no knowledge about most of the commandments in the old testament we possess today, including ones with penalties of being stoned or burnt at the stake. And finally, it explains why many parts of the bible are out of order, don't line up with each other, contradict each other even in the same passage, and are so complicated and hard to understand. As it stands, you can make it say pretty much anything you want.
body_html: I do tend to think the pagan gods might be real demons. However I wouldn't jump to conclusions. There is plenty of paganism in the old testament, and it's because it was edited by evil scribes to support such atrocity. Things like animal sacrifice, burning people at the stake, racism against Moabites and gentiles, hatred of eunuchs, invading foreign areas for no reason and killing and torturing everyone even the children and animals, priestly hierarchy, prophets killing children for the pettiest reasons, likely circumcision, and all those crazy gut-wrenching passages are later additions by scribes. Probably the really silly and petty rules too like not eating pork. It's hard to date when it first began and I suspect a few changes here and there have been introduced from the beginning as usual. But it appears that when it really picked up was in the time of Josiah. It says he rediscovered the holy and sacred book of rules of God that had somehow been misplaced for years in the temple. Riiiiiiiiiiiiight. And these supposedly "rediscovered" lost books of God very conveniently situated Josiah in positions of power and shat on exactly people he didn't like. He was later killed in battle that God told him not to engage in. Meanwhile Jeremiah was receiving prophesy about this and recorded it in his book which he sent to Josiah's son Jehoiakim, who hated it so much that as soon as he was done reading a page he'd throw it in his fireplace to be burned. This wouldn't be the last major fraud and redaction either, as after the return from the exile in Babylon further redactions were made, garbling the order of the prophets, editing the text to conform with later beliefs, adding even more laws, etc. It is likely that Ezra-Nehemiah are behind this one, whom even orthodox jews admit probably changed the text (interestingly an apocryphal book of Ezra records a story similar to Josiah's, where the law has been supposedly burnt by invading troops so Ezra rewrites it himself, as if there's only one copy of such sacred scripture. Quite an elaborate excuse he spun up if this account is accurate). This is the real reason the new testament contradicts the old testament so much (as well as the old testament itself often times). Because much of it is falsified by scribes. It's also why so many good characters in the old testament had no knowledge about most of the commandments in the old testament we possess today, including ones with penalties of being stoned or burnt at the stake. And finally, it explains why many parts of the bible are out of order, don't line up with each other, contradict each other even in the same passage, and are so complicated and hard to understand. As it stands, you can make it say pretty much anything you want.

post.body:
The more I read, the more I notice the connections. That's when it came to me... what if they aren't copies of the same stories, but the same story from different angles? Like the Great Flood, I implore that you look into Ragnarok and try to honestly tell me they aren't the same events shot at a different angle. Or perhaps the confirmation of the Egyptian Gods definitely being real by Bible canon; God cannot judge that which doesn't exist. Under this idea, I've been able to fill multiple gaps during my reading. The stone David threw? I bet it was an Omphalos stone. Why? Though God can make miracles happen outright, He prefers having method. When it describes the Four Horsemen bringing Hades as though it is an alternate name for Hell, what if it actually means that Underworld God Hades merely accompanied them, likely as a Leader. And by extension, hence the painless and sudden disappearance of those in Rapture, what if the Horseman of Death is specifically Thanatos? The evidence isn't always there, but when it is it works and I haven't necessarily stumbled upon anything to disprove this. 

Do you agree with this? Tell me what you think.
post.body_html:
The more I read, the more I notice the connections. That's when it came to me... what if they aren't copies of the same stories, but the same story from different angles? Like the Great Flood, I implore that you look into Ragnarok and try to honestly tell me they aren't the same events shot at a different angle. Or perhaps the confirmation of the Egyptian Gods definitely being real by Bible canon; God cannot judge that which doesn't exist. Under this idea, I've been able to fill multiple gaps during my reading. The stone David threw? I bet it was an Omphalos stone. Why? Though God can make miracles happen outright, He prefers having method. When it describes the Four Horsemen bringing Hades as though it is an alternate name for Hell, what if it actually means that Underworld God Hades merely accompanied them, likely as a Leader. And by extension, hence the painless and sudden disappearance of those in Rapture, what if the Horseman of Death is specifically Thanatos? The evidence isn't always there, but when it is it works and I haven't necessarily stumbled upon anything to disprove this.

Do you agree with this? Tell me what you think.
post.title: [Theory] The Bible is the Ultimate Crossover Event in all of Mythology

body: None, because otherwise I'd be dealing with the Pharisees. "Church" is a false translation of the word "assembly" which usually referred to the body of believers. They had underground gatherings which were nothing like the churches we have today, and disagreements were tolerated and not cause for division into different denominations. That alone exposes the failure of religious establishment, which was initially set up to control people and benefit the elites. This still happens today on a smaller scale with denominations, because they mostly retain the catholic church hierarchy: sit down, shut up, obey the pastor, don't speak out or question, and give us your money. Many of them have higher governing bodies as well, similar to the papacy. It doesn't work and only results in division over the silliest disagreements.

body: Why do you think society has always been so protective of women around men and so distrustful of men around women? The rules against males having contact with females go back ages. It's because people naturally perceive men as violent and sexual predators. This is partly because men do have uncontrollable sex drives, but the vast majority don't rape; the reason they still get seen as evil is because male faces are evil. First impressions dictate a lot more of our perception than we think, and male faces are designed to be ugly and mean looking as to scare away potential threats, so people look at them as threatening even when their actions prove otherwise. Female faces have the opposite, looking beautiful and innocent to attract empathy, hence why people have always been so much more lax on women even when they're just as capable.

post.body:
Remember back when leftists promoted sexual promiscuity around the clock and worked double extra hard to convince everyone that traditional sexual morality was somehow wrong?

They didn't do this because they wanted "free love." They did this because they had to destroy the existing positive paradigm before they could replace it with a horribly negative one.

Well they've moved on from "If it feels good...do it" to Orwell's Junior Anti-Sex League. The only kind of "sex" they promote is buggery and carpet munching, with pederasty waiting in the wings.

Human beings who have normal sexual interests which are correctly regulated will marry and start families. These families create children who grow up to be functional adults.

Functional adults is the last thing that leftists want to see. They want broken and damaged people to help them create hell on earth.

Remember when AntifaBLM proclaimed the destruction of families as one of their goals?

Not a coincidence.

body:
What do you think Jesus would say if you went up to him boasting about how holy you are and how glad you're not like the rest of those worldly sinners (everyone is guilty of this but you are proud)? What do you think he would have to say about your molestation rings? What would he do when he found church members manipulating people and exhorting them for money? How about when he saw you care more about politics than him? If you think boasting about your piety and judging others every chance you get is the way to go then it's clear you've never even read part of a gospel, or your interpretation is so twisted by false teachers to be unrecognizable. "All things are lawful for me" is not a free pass to do whatever you want if you have a sincere heart, especially when you judge another while you yourself do the same things. If you judge yourself, then you will not be judged; if you judge another instead, you will be judged the same way. I say this to show you your error, and not to pass judgement on you, lest I be judged myself.

And as far as your favorite issues go, if you saw what Jesus advocated for you'd probably consider him despicable. Love thy neighbor, love your enemies, women aren't just pieces of meat made for sexual pleasure, celibacy, spiritual family replacing the nuclear family, lack of politics, rejection of earthly authorities and religious institutionalism (does not mean rebellion), preaching to evildoers, likely acceptance of castration, woman deacons and apostles, opposition to legalism, all things likely to trigger IFB fragilities.
body_html:
What do you think Jesus would say if you went up to him boasting about how holy you are and how glad you're not like the rest of those worldly sinners (everyone is guilty of this but you are proud)? What do you think he would have to say about your molestation rings? What would he do when he found church members manipulating people and exhorting them for money? How about when he saw you care more about politics than him? If you think boasting about your piety and judging others every chance you get is the way to go then it's clear you've never even read part of a gospel, or your interpretation is so twisted by false teachers to be unrecognizable. "All things are lawful for me" is not a free pass to do whatever you want if you have a sincere heart, especially when you judge another while you yourself do the same things. If you judge yourself, then you will not be judged; if you judge another instead, you will be judged the same way. I say this to show you your error, and not to pass judgement on you, lest I be judged myself.

And as far as your favorite issues go, if you saw what Jesus advocated for you'd probably consider him despicable. Love thy neighbor, love your enemies, women aren't just pieces of meat made for sexual pleasure, celibacy, spiritual family replacing the nuclear family, lack of politics, rejection of earthly authorities and religious institutionalism (does not mean rebellion), preaching to evildoers, likely acceptance of castration, woman deacons and apostles, opposition to legalism, all things likely to trigger IFB fragilities.

But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.body:
Remember back when leftists promoted sexual promiscuity around the clock and worked double extra hard to convince everyone that traditional sexual morality was somehow wrong?

They didn't do this because they wanted "free love." They did this because they had to destroy the existing positive paradigm before they could replace it with a horribly negative one.

Well they've moved on from "If it feels good...do it" to Orwell's Junior Anti-Sex League. The only kind of "sex" they promote is buggery and carpet munching, with pederasty waiting in the wings.

Human beings who have normal sexual interests which are correctly regulated will marry and start families. These families create children who grow up to be functional adults.

Functional adults is the last thing that leftists want to see. They want broken and damaged people to help them create hell on earth.

Remember when AntifaBLM proclaimed the destruction of families as one of their goals?

Not a coincidence.

body: Your first remark was "Keep looking if they somehow have a woman or LGBTQEIEIO preacher". I run far away from any "church" that cares exclusively about that crap, and that's the typical IFB attitude as you demonstrated so elegantly already. Not only because that's exactly the attitude of the Pharisees and self-righteousness and judging others rather than yourself is strictly condemned, especially towards outsiders and/or for selfish gain, but also because 90% of the time the excessive focus on these issues is founded on a fetish for a submissive 1950s housewife who wears dresses and is skin and bones. This typically includes sex scandals and rape rings of religious leaders who molest women including young girls, and they can get away with it because the congregation is duped into believing everything their ~~false god~~ pastor says. It's not a coincidence that these things always happen in exactly the places obsessed with sexual topics and "keeping women in their place". And if Jesus came to an IFB church I guarantee you they'd have him condemned to hell and run out of there so fast that he wouldn't even have a chance to sit down.

body: It *wasn't* until this year for some reason. As someone who lives in a relatively conservative circle, I can say a few maybe felt uncomfortable around lgbts and sometimes acted weary of black strangers (not for racist reasons, but because of how they commit more crime and violence which they acknowledged was due to social factors and not connected to race) but that was it. They were otherwise true to their principles, limited government and constitutionalism and "rugged individualism" as it's sometimes called. Free speech, gun rights, religious freedom, free markets, etc. But apparently this year they've suddenly flipped their position and now they *do* seem to be going in a fascist direction, ironically similar to their worst enemies, the liberals. I'm not sure what prompted this but it's scary how quickly people can get out of control. A similar event happened with the millenials, who unbelievably used to be libertarians.

body: Can a girl do whatever she wants? No, but she can get away with a great deal more than a boy can. You don't really notice it however, because our perception is biased by our primal instincts before we even have time to process it; your brain has already determined that a crying woman is in a rough place and needs sympathy, and your brain has already determined that a crying man is just a violent mean piece of shit, before you even have time to think about it. Don't lie, this is what literally everyone thinks. Our brains are designed not to weigh these situations based on the facts, but on how it looks at first glance, and unfortunately this forms most of our opinion of something. And one of the metrics our minds use is how "cute" or "innocent" someone looks. And as the female is more valuable to nature due to the way reproduction works, they develop cuter and more innocent looking bodies and faces, so that they will attract more sympathy and protection. The male is the expendable machine designed not for himself but to provide for the female, and as such they develop to look more ugly and mean. They're also most desirable as someone who will sacrifice themselves for the woman, and as such are generally not regarded as having the right to burden others by complaining about their own problems. There are very simple and logical biological reasons for these trends and that's what's at fault here. It's not as if people say to themselves "I'm going to worship women and all men are bad and I hate them and they deserve to be hated". It's just how we're hardwired to respond to these sorts of stimuli.
body_html: Can a girl do whatever she wants? No, but she can get away with a great deal more than a boy can. You don't really notice it however, because our perception is biased by our primal instincts before we even have time to process it; your brain has already determined that a crying woman is in a rough place and needs sympathy, and your brain has already determined that a crying man is just a violent mean piece of shit, before you even have time to think about it. Don't lie, this is what literally everyone thinks. Our brains are designed not to weigh these situations based on the facts, but on how it looks at first glance, and unfortunately this forms most of our opinion of something. And one of the metrics our minds use is how "cute" or "innocent" someone looks. And as the female is more valuable to nature due to the way reproduction works, they develop cuter and more innocent looking bodies and faces, so that they will attract more sympathy and protection. The male is the expendable machine designed not for himself but to provide for the female, and as such they develop to look more ugly and mean. They're also most desirable as someone who will sacrifice themselves for the woman, and as such are generally not regarded as having the right to burden others by complaining about their own problems. There are very simple and logical biological reasons for these trends and that's what's at fault here. It's not as if people say to themselves "I'm going to worship women and all men are bad and I hate them and they deserve to be hated". It's just how we're hardwired to respond to these sorts of stimuli.

body: Bullshit. This is one of the things that makes it difficult for me to buy evolution, it all sounds very suspiciously like an excuse to call some people worth more than others. And I don't care that the party of "love and tolerance" likes it, we all know what their true origins are.

parent.body:
Western society refers to the evolution of civilization from Europe and the Mediterranean.  The descendents of Africa tribesmen and their ancestors were never part of that evolution nor are they trying to assimilate now.

The most advanced and successful line of humanity has been increasingly tainted and diluted by Africans such as these for 150 years, leading to serious degeneration today.

Western society refers to the evolution of civilization from Europe and the Mediterranean. The descendents of Africa tribesmen and their ancestors were never part of that evolution nor are they trying to assimilate now.

The most advanced and successful line of humanity has been increasingly tainted and diluted by Africans such as these for 150 years, leading to serious degeneration today.

post.title: "Degeneration of western society is a stupid myth by butthurt people" - that's what I was thinking a few weeks ago while not consuming any modern American media. I was wrong, you were right. I'm sorry.

body:
> that doesn't make erotica bad

It's the objectification of women (or men) that's bad. I don't think you can be blamed for impulses but watching real videos of real people being sexualized isn't much different than prostitution.

> you aren't even a christian

You keep saying that even though I am.

> Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there.

So you're basically just going to ignore it because you don't like that it doesn't align with your selfish values. I agree the bible isn't always accurate but this teaching fits with the overall God-given principle. You seem to be motivated more by a desire that everyone should be exactly like you.

> You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well.

I never denied God was real nor do I detest him. What I detest is people doing evil in God's name. People using "God" as an excuse to demand special treatment for themselves while mistreating others. Do you know who the Pharisees and Sadducees were?

> Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute.

That's what *you* do with your "proof texts" to support your crazy doctrines such as women should be nothing but pieces of meat at mens' disposal. I can't speak for you but in my experience people saying those things do that, quote little bits from Paul's letters (most of which aren't even really his) and a few other pieces and twist it any way they want to. And rarely ever giving the gospels, the literal words of Jesus, any attention.

> without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.

In contrast, I understand it much better than I used to, when I was like you, when I fell for all these lies of TV preachers and political theology. The Holy Spirit taught me far more clearly. Things are starting to make sense now.
body_html:
that doesn't make erotica bad

It's the objectification of women (or men) that's bad. I don't think you can be blamed for impulses but watching real videos of real people being sexualized isn't much different than prostitution.

you aren't even a christian

You keep saying that even though I am.

Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there.

So you're basically just going to ignore it because you don't like that it doesn't align with your selfish values. I agree the bible isn't always accurate but this teaching fits with the overall God-given principle. You seem to be motivated more by a desire that everyone should be exactly like you.

You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well.

I never denied God was real nor do I detest him. What I detest is people doing evil in God's name. People using "God" as an excuse to demand special treatment for themselves while mistreating others. Do you know who the Pharisees and Sadducees were?

Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute.

That's what you do with your "proof texts" to support your crazy doctrines such as women should be nothing but pieces of meat at mens' disposal. I can't speak for you but in my experience people saying those things do that, quote little bits from Paul's letters (most of which aren't even really his) and a few other pieces and twist it any way they want to. And rarely ever giving the gospels, the literal words of Jesus, any attention.

without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.

In contrast, I understand it much better than I used to, when I was like you, when I fell for all these lies of TV preachers and political theology. The Holy Spirit taught me far more clearly. Things are starting to make sense now.

parent.body:
Of course you're not surprised, friend. You claim to have knowledge, which is questionable at best, I mean, after all we are all sitting at some kind of connected device and can find and repeat tons of information on anything we want, but you lack wisdom.

The porn industry is horrendous, that doesn't make erotica bad. Starbucks is a garbage company that does more harm than good, are we supposed to condemn all coffee beans?

Your questions and responses are juvenile at best and would sound fine coming out of the mouth of a young believer eager to learn, but you aren't even a christian, so they just come off as sophomoric and dumb. Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there. You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well. So you don't want to be a christian, why spend the time and effort harassing others who do? Your like so many other atheists out there, so smart, right? Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute. Again, better men (or women) than you have already done what you are doing and it hasn't killed christianity, but I guess in the year of our Lord 2021 a lot of people have a lot of time on their hands.

Do something constructive with your time because harassing people for the sake of harassing people is a sign of some kind of mental deficiency or psychotic obsession. All you are doing is making yourself look a fool and discussing things you know about but can't possibly understand. Yes, yes, I know: You are soooooo learned and you could run rings around me with your vast knowledge of, well, whatever you say you have vast knowledge of, and that's fine, but without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.
parent.body_html:
Of course you're not surprised, friend. You claim to have knowledge, which is questionable at best, I mean, after all we are all sitting at some kind of connected device and can find and repeat tons of information on anything we want, but you lack wisdom.

The porn industry is horrendous, that doesn't make erotica bad. Starbucks is a garbage company that does more harm than good, are we supposed to condemn all coffee beans?

Your questions and responses are juvenile at best and would sound fine coming out of the mouth of a young believer eager to learn, but you aren't even a christian, so they just come off as sophomoric and dumb. Your insistence that I read scripture and your quotes of scripture are humorous and silly! It would be like me thinking I could tell a brain surgeon how to perform a surgery simply because I've read a bunch of books and know the history of the medical profession. Sure I might know a lot, but the meat of knowledge, the know how, the understanding would not be there. You lack the Holy spirit and by the things you post I can see you detest him! The questions you post and your comments are the words of one who knows God is real but hates Him, so time is spent trying to convince others to hate Him as well. So you don't want to be a christian, why spend the time and effort harassing others who do? Your like so many other atheists out there, so smart, right? Loaded with tons of "gotcha" catch phrases and little bits of scripture, its cute. Again, better men (or women) than you have already done what you are doing and it hasn't killed christianity, but I guess in the year of our Lord 2021 a lot of people have a lot of time on their hands.

Do something constructive with your time because harassing people for the sake of harassing people is a sign of some kind of mental deficiency or psychotic obsession. All you are doing is making yourself look a fool and discussing things you know about but can't possibly understand. Yes, yes, I know: You are soooooo learned and you could run rings around me with your vast knowledge of, well, whatever you say you have vast knowledge of, and that's fine, but without the imbuing of the Holy spirit you will never grasp an understanding of scripture, and you should be summarily ignored.
